displayText: Okay, welcome to the second meeting of this design group. Sorry. We we saw that the problems with existing remote controls were a boring shape and boring colour. And we saw that what we needed to do was to make sure the device controls several items, that switching was easy, that you shouldn't need to point the thing at anything in particular, that it need to be contoured to make it interesting, that the keys might be concave, simply because that hasn't been done before that we know of. Should have interchangeable fascias so people can personalise it, illuminated so that people can see it in dark rooms. And that people might want it as in addition to their existing remote controls. And that it should just always work, whenever you mm use it. And that it shouldn't be too small, mm that it gets lost. Um. Now I'll shortly ask for three three presentations. The the management has had it's own thoughts on this and they don't necessarily agree with what we thought.
